Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
public class Board extends Object
The Board class represents a Tic Tac Toe board. It manages the grid where moves are made and provides methods to place moves, check for winners, checks if the board is full, and it displays the board.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private char[][]
    grid
    The Tic Tac Toe grid is represented as a 3x3 matrix.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board()
    This is the constructor to construct a new Board and initializes it to a 3x3 grid filled with empty spaces.

  • Field Details

    • grid

      private char[][] grid
      The Tic Tac Toe grid is represented as a 3x3 matrix. Each cell stores X's, O's, or a blank spaces

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      This is the constructor to construct a new Board and initializes it to a 3x3 grid filled with empty spaces.

  • Method Details

    • emptySpot

      public boolean emptySpot(int row, int column, char symbol)
      Places a move on the board if the spot is empty.
      Parameters:
      row - row index from 0 to 2
      column - column index from 0 to 2
      symbol - X's or O's
      Returns:
      true if move was successful

    • checkWinner

      public boolean checkWinner(char ticTacToeSymbol)
      Checks if a player has won by getting three of their symbols in a row, column, or diagonal.
      Parameters:
      ticTacToeSymbol - 'X' or 'O'
      Returns:
      true if this player has won, false otherwise

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Prints the current state of the board to the console.

    • fullBoard

      public boolean fullBoard(char ticTacToeSymbol1, char ticTacToeSymbol2)
      Checks if the board is full (no empty spaces left).
      Parameters:
      ticTacToeSymbol1 - Symbol for player 1
      ticTacToeSymbol2 - Symbol for player 2
      Returns:
      true if board is full, false otherwise
